name: Squat Jumps
how_to_perform:
1. Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart, toes pointing forward or slightly outward.
2. Lower your body down into a squat position, keeping your back straight and your weight centered over your feet.
3. Push explosively upwards from the squat position, extending your hips and knees fully.
4. Land softly on the balls of your feet before immediately repeating the movement, trying to land in the same position as when you started.
5. Continue alternating between squatting and jumping for the desired duration,
6. Engage your core by drawing your belly button towards your spine
7. Try to perform the squats quickly but explosively, using your legs and glutes to drive yourself upwards
short_summary: Squat Jumps are a plyometric exercise that involves rapid repetition of squat movements, providing a cardio-intensive workout while improving strength in the leg muscles.
